de.dosmike.sponge.megamenus.impl

Class RenderManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dosmike.sponge.megamenus.impl.RenderManager

  • public final class RenderManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Keeps track of all active MenuRenderer instances and provides convenience access methods for renderer and menus

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RenderManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.Collection<MenuRenderer> getRenderFor(IMenu menu)
      this might return a render for each viewer or one render for all viewers depending on whether the menu is implemented as shared menu or single viewer menu.
      static java.util.Optional<MenuRenderer> getRenderFor(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
      Returns the renderer the player is currently viewing from all renderer registered.
      static void kickFromAll(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
      since InteractInventoryEvent.Close is only fired if the PLAYER closes the inventory we need to untrack closing the inventory through monitoring other events and calling this.
      Note that it is assumed that the calling event is expected to require the menu to already be closed
      static void notifyRenderChange(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer, MenuRenderer targetRender)
      When a player changes the target render, they have to be kicked out of all other renders.
      static void register(MenuRenderer menuRenderer)
      Register a new renderer.
      If the AnimationManager was not yet set or removed it will be instantiated again.
      Notifies the renderer of being resumed if a listener is present.
      static void tickRendering()
      this method will invoke automatic refreshing for all menus with animated elements

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RenderManager

        public RenderManager()

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public static void register(MenuRenderer menuRenderer)
        Register a new renderer.
        If the AnimationManager was not yet set or removed it will be instantiated again.
        Notifies the renderer of being resumed if a listener is present.
        Parameters:
        menuRenderer - the renderer to register

      • getRenderFor

        public static java.util.Optional<MenuRenderer> getRenderFor(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        Returns the renderer the player is currently viewing from all renderer registered.
        Parameters:
        viewer - the player to search a renderer for
        Returns:
        the currently active renderer for this player, if any

      • getRenderFor

        public static java.util.Collection<MenuRenderer> getRenderFor(IMenu menu)
        this might return a render for each viewer or one render for all viewers depending on whether the menu is implemented as shared menu or single viewer menu.
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu to look for
        Returns:
        all renderer, where the rendered menu equals the passed menu, or (where the rendered menu is a bound instance) the passed menu is the base menu

      • notifyRenderChange

        public static void notifyRenderChange(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer,
                                      MenuRenderer targetRender)
        When a player changes the target render, they have to be kicked out of all other renders. This will use closeSilent in order to prevent the new targetRender from closing.
        Parameters:
        viewer - the targeted player
        targetRender - the renderer that is now observed by the viewer

      • kickFromAll

        public static void kickFromAll(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        since InteractInventoryEvent.Close is only fired if the PLAYER closes the inventory we need to untrack closing the inventory through monitoring other events and calling this.
        Note that it is assumed that the calling event is expected to require the menu to already be closed
        Parameters:
        viewer - the player to kick from rendering

      • tickRendering

        public static void tickRendering()
        this method will invoke automatic refreshing for all menus with animated elements
